intro: Calcearia ponapensis, commonly known as the Caroline Islands starwort, is a flowering plant native to the tropical Pacific, specifically the island of Pohnpei. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its small, star-shaped flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to saline and sandy soils. Calcearia ponapensis is known for its delicate appearance and is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and unique ecological adaptations.
